title: 'Palak Desai'
description: Joanna gets herself reinstated to the case on a technicality — and plays her trump card. Watch now.

title: palak Desai
description: A sublime oil painting by Marc Chagall, owned by the people of Canada since 1956, is going up for auction in New York next month as the National Gallery of Canada rejigs its art-retention policies. The proceeds - perhaps as much as US$9 million - will go to buy more art. One art critic calls a move a "monumental stupidity."

title: Stanley Cup saying goodbye to some NHL legends' names
description: The names of the Hockey Hall of Famers and other players who won NHL championships from 1954-65, including Gordie Howe, are being stripped off the Stanley Cup this spring to create room for others.

title: Why several trainloads of New Yorkers' poop has been stranded for months in Alabama
description: Millions of kilograms of sewer sludge from New York and New Jersey has been rotting in the Parrish, Ala., railyard since January, and Mayor Heather Hall wants it gone.

title: 'I'm just so sick of it': Jack White on being called an old-fashioned analog guy & whether rock is dying

title: How this man, at 19, ended up as Martin Luther King Jr.'s personal driver
description: In 1966, Coretta Scott King hired a 19-year-old named Tom Houck as the family's driver. Houck now shows people landmarks that are significant to the civil rights leader's story.

title: Classified's new video is a powerful ode to missing & murdered Indigenous women
description: The Canadian rapper's new single 'Powerless' shines a light on sexual abuse and missing & murdered Indigenous women. He wrote an impassioned post on Facebook saying, 'We need to speak up for these kids... don't let them feel powerless.' Watch now.

title: Hunting The KGB Killers: the story of a shocking political assassination
description: This former KGB spy was assassinated using the world’s deadliest poison. His death took detectives on an international manhunt leading straight to the Kremlin. Watch now.

title: Erik Karlsson unlikely to finish season with Senators
description: Ottawa Senators captain Erik Karlsson won't play Wednesday night against the Buffalo Sabres, and coach Guy Boucher​ says he's not expecting the defenceman to join the team for its final two games.

title: Canada now 6-1 at curling worlds after Gushue rout of Norway
description: Canada improved to 6-1, tied with Scotland's Bruce Mouat for second behind Sweden's Niklas Edin at 7-1. The Norwegians dropped to 6-2, so Canada's win over them had playoff seeding implications.

title: Want to trade your desk job for a cabin in the woods? This guy did it
description: Norm Carlson used to work a desk job, but a year-and-a-half ago he moved onto a homestead on the Yukon River, more than 100 km downstream from Dawson City. He has no phone, but he does have an Internet connection and a hot tub.

title: How fungi paved the way for humans to evolve after an asteroid wiped out the dinosaurs
description: Hundreds of millions of years ago an asteroid strike wiped out 70% of all species on earth.  Fungi — nature's ultimate survivor — thrived to inherit the earth.  But so did an until-then insignificant animal group, mammals.
